Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Gemma A
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing I have to say about this hotel is that the location was close to Termini Stazione which was handy getting around but everything else was just terrible. The rooms were tiny and smelled like mothballs. We had to share a disgusting bathroom that looked as if it had never been cleaned. The staff were quite rude and did not really assist when asking for simple directions. We did not even attempt to eat there due to other people staying there advised us not to. The most ridiculous thing about the place however is the cost. They expect you to pay an enormous amount for low quality. I will ensure I do intense research before I choose another hotel last minute. Worst experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs!!!”
Reviews.Author: jack435
Reviews.Content: We are a young british married couple, the hotel was not a bad location as its close to the termini. The website is a complete lie and is nothing like the real hotel! Our room was a disgrace, the floors were dirty, bed sheets were stained and had holes in aswell as the curtains, dust covered pretty much the whole room especially on the bed when pulling the bedsheets back, wallpaper was hanging off in numerous places, several cracks in the ceiling, furniture was dirty, extra sheets and pillows in the wardrobe which was filthy and very very smelly and musty, the bathroom was falling apart, toilet seat was broken, shower head was coming off the wall and when having a shower it flooded the bathroom which then leaked into the bedroom our solution was to build a dam using the towels provided (which were also stained with black marks and even what looked like blood on one). The staff wasnt very friendly or helpfull as when i went to tell them about the flooding shower the man behind the desk simply said, "theres nothing i can do"! Breakfast was abismal, there was a choice of, toast in a packet, bread rolls and croissants with what i hope was icing or something on top, there was a juice machine and that was it. The glasses used for the juice were filthy. The breakfast area stunk of cigarettes as they stood behind the other side of the desk and smoked. Me and my wife stayed out as late as we could so we could spend minimum time possible in the hotel (literally to sleep). Overall as i said above i would avoid the HOTEL BIANCA at all costs!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Trish T
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel we could find at short notice or we would have moved. There was a lot happening in Rome at the time. We had a shared bathroom that was disgusting, fortunately we had taken toilet wipes so we cleaned it before we used it. They recommend taking jandals for showering but gumboots were required for this one!! Orange soap scum everywhere. The floor in our room still had cigarette ash on it when we arrived & was still there when we left, the aircon was noisy, shutters rusting, Generally dirty. Breakfast was basic but the nice indonesian waiter made a nice cup of tea. Was handy to the termini which was its best feature!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling standards”
Reviews.Author: Nec_11
Reviews.Content: Its not really necessary to add to the reviews for this hotel but it was so bad, i felt i had to. The room was falling apart, the window shutters were rusted shut so the room was in constant darkness, the taps in the bathroom fell off and rust has overrun many of the appliances. I feel lucky to have not gotten stuck in the creaking, dodgy lift. To top it all off, the included breakfast consisted of stale croissants and bread. That's it! Cereal cost extra and the juice machine was broken (putting out a jug of juice out has obviously not occured to them).

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: OZTraveller17
Reviews.Content: I was staying there as part of a tour but had booked 3 additional nights after the tour finished. They moved me to a single room with a leaking loud airconditioner and had to use a shared bathroom which was disgusting. I asked to be moved to another room but the rude person at the desk said that i had to stay there for one night atleast. I just walked out around the corner and booked another hotel which was meant to be 3 star but turned out to be 5 star in comparison. There are so many hotels in the area and would strongly suggest to book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously not recommended”
Reviews.Author: JackieP82
Reviews.Content: We are a 30-year old Canadian couple and went to Hotel Bianca in June 2011. It was honestly the worst hotel we went to during our 2 week-stay in Italy. The location is NOT great. Of course, it is located near the termini, which is practical. But every Italian we met told us it was a dangerous neighbourhood at night. The hotel was creepy in itself, but our room was simply disgusting: really weird smell, wallpaper hanging down from the walls and the bathroom was covered with filth. For the exact same price, we strongly recommend to rather go to Maria Luisa B&B, where we also stayed. It's still very modest, but at least it is clean. Even though it is also near the termini, you can feel that it is in a much safer and animated area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Frankenstein.”
Reviews.Author: Mmoam
Reviews.Content: "Hotel" Bianca is a stinky, old, creepy, dirty nightmare. The website is a lie. Even if your only parameter is location, don't choose this place. After one horrible night we ran away never to return.

Reviews.Title: “Building is very bad,very expensive and very awful breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Dura59
Reviews.Content: You do not stay in this hotel. I stayed three nights. Hotel nasty smells.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoctor48
Reviews.Content: it is so close to the termini, there is a lift, tho small is very useful. rooms are big and clean. the decor may look tired but the bed is comfortable. there is a lot of noise from the street, afterall it is close to the train station. but overall it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - wierd and not clean”
Reviews.Author: kangaroo50
Reviews.Content: We found this place wierd - from the bizarre "dated" furnishings - metal on the bedside tables like in a hospital, the maids smoking in the cupboard between our rooms from early in the morning (wish they'd done their job..), the strange table nazi at breakfast - he had an odd way of seating people randomly, not with your friends...we couldn't wait to leave! The pictures on the walls are scary, the plates and cutlery are left out all night and covered with soot in the morning, breakfast is bread and cordial (there was a fly in the cordial), it smells funny and the service behind the counter leaves much to be desired (why is a family sitting there watching TV and smoking in the non-smoking hotel instead of giving us our key??) On the bright side - it's located close to transport for around Rome. I would stay further away rather than at hotel bianca again!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: AyrApple
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a great location 5 mins from were u get off the airport bus it was so simple to find i had read the reviews before we went and most of them were correct the hotel has not been refurbished the rooms are basic we were in room 32 lovely hand painted ceiling a good size room with a leather couch and a chair my sister was in room 31 no chairs to sit on if you need a hairdrier take your own as the one in the bathroom is held together with tape as for the shower dont expect a curtain its more like a mini wet room no probs there the towels are very fine more like a tablecloth but i was surprised they dried you perfect breakfast is juice tea coffee bread butter jam so dont expect eggs but it was fine for us great supermarkets near at hand staff are realy nice and helpfull it is a basic clean hotel u get what u pay for it did us just fine if i were to go back to rome i would stay here

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Experience Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyOlympia
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Bianca was filthy, smelled of stale cigarette smoke and was run by people who looked half dead. The rooms had broken light fixtures, kitchen towels for bath towels and walls that either had peeling wallpaper or were in need of painting. There was a picture on the wall in the hall of a person with hollow eyes holding an owl - the whole place creeped out me and my 3 fellow vacationers. It looks NOTHING like the pics on the website and the only good thing that can be said about this overpriced, rundown and decrepit place is that it is close to Termini Stazzione. Of course that has its difficulties in that the denizens of the area were of seedy character. I can't say enough about NOT STAYING THERE. A few blocks away, and for less money, we moved into a perfectly acceptable hotel - The Fiamma, and were glad for the change.

Reviews.Title: “near termini, Helpful and Simple..”
Reviews.Author: sekar303
Reviews.Content: when august 2006, me and my family went to rome. and stayed at bianca that was very HELPFUL and SIMPLE. because it's near from roma termini. when u are a tourist, u want to go to museum and other famous building, then u have to take a tour bus. and it's in termini. and the other advantages, when u are going to paris or amsterdam, u just go for walk 10 mnts and u are already in train that go to there. simple.. and for food, i recomended, KEBAB. it's beside the hotel.. nicee.. for facilities? so so, but look at the advantages..

Reviews.Title: “unless absolutely necessary do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: nikolas_from_greece
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bianca Hotel for 3 nights in Easter 2007, which is High Season for Rome, for the price of 113 euros /night. A reasonable price for this hotel would be 50 euros maximum for a double room. The good thing about the hotel is its very central location (Termini Station, metro, buses etc) and the fact that the rooms, though not very clean, are spacious. The bad things are the following The staff is highly unhelpful although I was speaking to them in Italian. The breakfast was horrendous, the croissants must have been baked at least a decade ago, the breakfast room was not very clean and the whole atmosphere of the hotel pathetic. I would not recommend this hotel and I would definitely not stay there another time unless I could not find something relatively cheap nearby. As a conclusion, 113 euros/night for this hotel is far too much........

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Fathe_of_seven
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the beginning of March 2007 and we enjoyed our stay. The room was spacious and very clean. We would have appreciated higher light levels. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was adequate, as much as we could eat. Good location for catching buses to all parts of the city. We would be happy to use this hotel again and recommend it for people who want simple accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ashbrow
Reviews.Content: The Bianca is ideally situated near to all the main attractions and is the ideal gateway to enter and leave the eternal city. Our two couples enjoyed clean spacoius rooms in the quiet area at the rear and enjoyed a hearty breakfast with lashings of superb local coffee. The Bianca is excellent value for money and do try to ignore the doom and gloom merchants who find fault with everything that is not perfect. Remember what you have paid and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: SJCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed our last night in Italy at this hotel, on Sept. 26th, 2006. I picked it because of its very close proximity to Termini Station, where we were arriving into from Perugia. Plus it was all I could get, even booking as far ahead as February!!!; in that price range in that location. We walked the two blocks with all our luggage with ease. The hotel is old and run down; but the beds were comfortable and spotless. The shower did not work, only sprayed out little bursts of water, so you would have to wash in the sink to get clean. There was however, plenty of hot water there, providing you had not just flushed the toilet! The hotel is on the first floor of a locked building, but the staff buzz you in 24 hrs a day; so it feels safe in that location. The staff were very helpful, and helped us book a car for the airport for 04:30 the next morning; gave us a 03:30 wake-up call; and waited at the front door with us at 04:30 so we would not get in the wrong cab or get mugged in the street. The hotel rooms are in dire need of a face-lift, especially at E120 per night!!; but it was the convenience I was after, and it worked out fine. I would not stay there again, as I like a working shower; but I want to emphasise that the staff were great, and that was important. Convenient for the station if that's what you need.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, not fab but ok!”
Reviews.Author: Rhiann_Browski
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 night visit from the Bianca. I travelled with my partner and mum & dad. I have to agree with other reviews, it is very centrally located, but in need of a bit of a face lift. However, it wasn't dirty...maids clean everyday, and the breakfast was fine.... the coffee was strong but i was glad for the boost! Ask for a room on the front and you'll get a fab view of the main station.

Reviews.Title: “Hot hot hot!!!!”
Reviews.Author: catchatter
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to the railway termini making it a convenient place to stay I would say if you are travelling on a budget use this hotel if not stay somewhere else there are lots of other hotels in this area We had room 36 at the front of the property overlooking the street But also above the TV lounge so a little noisy Also as the Station Termini is just accross the street you can here the tannoy in the early hours Air conditioning in room was a waste of time as room was huge with high ceilings it was very hot Shower was fantastic although took a little while for the hot water to reach us Towels were good size but were like cotton sheets very strange they did what they were supposed to do The bathroom was as stated in earlier reviews more of a wet room, watch where you put your feet, don't cover drain or you'll flood the room!!!! Breakfast was edible don't try the rolls if you have delicate teeth Cake was nice but for breakfast??? Coffee is really strong stand your spoon up in and the milk was hot Staff were friendly, reception is on the second floor, the lift is tiny room for three people

Reviews.Title: “Its that itchy sweater that you learn to love”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very close to the train station and we did not have any problems with crime. The selling point for us was not the room (which left a lot to the imagination) but the fact that the second time we came to the downstairs door they recognized us and rang us in without us having to ask. They remembered our name which is not something that you find very often. Even though breakfast was just coffee and bread it was good coffee and very good bread. I did leave with a few bug bites but the bed was comfortable. If we were to go again we would stay. We suggest that a trip to Rome should be at least 6 days long and if you can go during the Easter holiday it pays off. Culture week was the same week as holy week and all of the museums and ruins had free admission which was great because the lines were very very short. Keep in mind that this was not only for Rome but for Florence too. Also make it a point to visit the catacombs they are worth the trip out of the city and the area surronding the catacombs is beautiful. San Callisto was wonderful. Do be aware though that the beggars are numerous and very pushy especially in Rome. The metro had a good number of police officers present but it is still not as good as the tube in London or in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad I only stayed 1 night at Hotel Bianca”
Reviews.Author: stdonatus
Reviews.Content: I only stayed 1 night - May 4 at Hotel Bianca as I just needed a hotel very close to Termini, which it is -- about 2 blocks from Termini. Room was good sized, decor very dated (think 1950), not the cleanest room I've ever been in (and I'm no Martha Stewart). There was no shower curtain in the bathroom, which I found kind of odd. Overall, it was kind of depressing, but thankfully I only slept there for one night. It would have been nice to have 1 channel of English language TV (like CNN or BBC), but for one night at 75 Euros, I survived. However, I would not recommend it for more than 1 or 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel in the end of march 2006 I must said that the location is good but otherwise it is a old and not user friendly hotel. I lived in the 4th floor with room with a toilet and shower. When I and my wife entered the room, we both sense an unpleasant smell. The wall was dirty and the bed sheet like awful. The light was dim. The heating system did not work at all. The television is an 14 inche size TV but function was OK. The shower water temperature was satisfactory but the water pressure was too low ( actually dribbling from the water tap ). The staff in the hotel was just OK but not very helpful. The breakfast was just three pieces of bread with jam. Moreover the services by the man in the restaurant was poor as well. I had travel several city in italy ( including milano, venice, and firenze ). Hotel in these cities ( Not Bianca) was quite satisfactory. Location is the only attactive point of this hotel. But I found that actually there are a lot of good hotel near the central termini. I will not recommend this hotel to my friend if they go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stepped of the airpoter bus and were literally 2mins away from our hotel. The location was fantastic, you dont have to haul luggage or get a taxi just cross the road, drop of your bags and get started. The rooms were basic but big and were extremely clean with a great view from our window. We had our own bathroom with one of the best showers ive ever got in a hotel. The staff spoke pretty good english and so communication was easy. The brerakfast was simple but all we needed for an early start and a tv lounge was available for anyone who good bored of all of Romes amazing sights. Location was great as all major sights (except the Vatican) were within walking distance and the metro station was right across the road for anyone who would rather not walk. Although the area was a bit run down neither my partner or myself felt threatened at any time. The hotel offered a tv in the room, hair dryer and fresh towels. Prefect for young people, students and travellers, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenc
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried on seeing some negative comments about this hotel but when five of us stayed there in November, in five single, en suite rooms, we all thought it was exceptional value for money. We paid €59 each for rooms that were clean and quiet and which included a basic breakfast of coffee and rolls. Given its excellent location by the station I don't think we could have done better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Bianca is great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in this hotel in August and had picked it as it was close to the main train station and the reviews hadn't been too bad. When we arrived there was a very friendly man on reception who remained friendly throughout our stay. Our room was number 66 - we had requested a twin and ended up with a triple which suited us fine! There was a shower, toilet and sink in the bathroom that all seemed clean. We had a tv in the main room (although we couldn't find an english channel, but why would you want to watch tv in Rome?!) We didn't have an issue with the cleaners being too loud as we were up and out every morning but half past 8 so we didn't see them at all. They provded us with clean sheets every day. The breakfast consisted of croissants and rolls (which were a bit hard) but it certainly filled us up for the day. We were also given tea and/or coffee but you could have requested various juices. The hotel in near the train station and this area is not dangerous, just a little seedy. My friend and are were both young females and we didn't encounter any problems (other than the Italian men loving women and just staring at you but you get used to that!) Overall I would say this hotel is well worth staying in!

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel from Hotel Saturnia after a huge debarkle. The hotel is on the 2nd, 3rd and 4th floors but has a very small lift/elevator. We stayed in Room 34, it had a sink and tv but no shower and 2 single beds pushed together. The beds were just metal frames with a spring and wire configuration, but my bed had several springs missing and string had been used to replace them (leaving a big lop-sided sag in the bed); eventually we managed to solve most of our bed issues by using cable-ties. The room was air-conditioned but it was centrally controlled and turned on only in the afternoon/evening for a few hours. The room was also very smokey smelling and we couldn't open the windows due to being right on the main square with emergency vehicles, busses and trucks passing at all hours (v.noisey). In our original deal we had arranged to have a bath/shower in our room but when we were moved this didn't follow us. We were therefor required to use the shared shower (a room with the shower head placed in front of the toilet and a sink; don't forget to move the loo paper!). The shower and toilet never seemed particularly clean and were on the other side of the floor from the rooms without bathrooms (rooms 34, 35 and 36 on our floor; according to the fire exit map). As mentioned in another review the maids were up bright and early chatting loudly. However, after our cable-tie rigging of our bed they did make it up as a double. There were fresh towels everyday (the strange European sheet kind). Breakfast was served in a formally set dining room by a strange little indian man (reminded me of Manuel from Faulty Towers; friendly but odd). It consisted of croissants and rolls (which were quite hard and hollow), and apricot or peach jam. Tea and coffee were provided and on the last day we asked for juice, which we were offered in several different flavours. There was also a shared lounge area with a bar and large screen TV, though it looked like it was used more by the employees and there friends. This would be an OK place place to stay if you had a rear room with a bathroom (not 34, 35 or 36). There wasn't much in the way of dining in the area but a very cheap internet calling centre was next door.

Reviews.Title: “Bianca is ok!”
Reviews.Author: chrism1966
Reviews.Content: Central location, very near metro and train station, basic facilities, dated decor. Yes the drains do smell, but not all the time. Staff were ok maids are friendly but loud, just the italian way i guess, The area has a bad reputation for crime, but it seems to have cleaned up its act, i felt safe most of the time, beggers are a big problem. Dont fall foe any of their tricks. Yes i would stay again, watch out for the dated lift!!

Reviews.Title: “A basic place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location, but I think you can find better for the money. The room was very basic with a strange add-on bathroom and smell. Our room faced a quiet courtyard but the cleaning staff chatted loudly in Italian outside our room very early in mornings! Staff wasn't too friendly and breakfast was just coffee and bread. Good location for exploring the city, but we wouldn't stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Bianca Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Volturno 48, 00185 Rome, Italy
